maml:description.maml:para: Some flows return an base64 encoded string in the payload. Use this function to convert it.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Add example description here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Use the GRR search function to search for clients. The function returns only the computername or the whole GRR object.

maml:Description.maml:para: Search string with the needed prefix, e.g. label: or host:...
Search string with the needed prefix, e.g. label: or host:...

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Find-GRRClient -SearchString keyword -Credential $cred

dev:remarks.maml:para: Find GRR clients based on keywords. Use the available prefixes, e.g. "label:" or "host:" to limit the search results.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Find-GRRClient -SearchString keyword -Credential $cred -OnlyNode

dev:remarks.maml:para: Find GRR clients based on keywords. Use the available prefixes, e.g. "label:" or "host:" to limit the search results. Use `OnlyNode` to only display the host names.

maml:description.maml:para: Search for clients with a given label.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Find-GRRClientByLabel -Credential $creds -SearchString keyword

dev:remarks.maml:para: Search for clients with a specific label.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Find-GRRClientByLabel -Credential $creds -SearchString keyword -OnlyNode

dev:remarks.maml:para: Search for clients with a specific label and show only the host names.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of all GRR artifacts.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-GRRArtifact -Credential $cred

dev:remarks.maml:para: List all artifacts.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $osx = Get-GRRArtifact -Credential $cred | ? {$_.name -match "osx"} | select name, description, iscustom PS C:\> $osx
Name Description IsCustom ---- ----------- -------- OSXSPHardwareDataType Mac OS X system profiler. False OSXServices Running services from the Max OS X service management framework. False OSXUsers Users directories in /Users False

dev:remarks.maml:para: List all artifacts which have "osx" in the name.

maml:description.maml:para: Convert a computername into the corresponding GRR client id.

maml:Description.maml:para: Use the switch to only show the latest seen client id.
Use the switch to only show the latest seen client id.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Search for the client ids for the two hosts.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-GRRClientIdFromComputerName -ComputerName host1,host2 -Credential $creds -OnlyLastSeen
Node ClientId LastSeenAt OSVersion ---- -------- ---------- --------- host1 C.1111111111111111 18.05.2017 15:48:17 10.0.10586 host2 C.3333333333333333 26.06.2017 09:31:32 6.1.7601

dev:remarks.maml:para: Search for the client ids for the two hosts. If multiple client ids are found, the parameter "OnlyLastSeen" reduce the output to last seen one per each host. Compare the output to EXAMPLE 1.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> (Get-GRRClientIdFromComputerName -ComputerName host1,host2 -Credential $creds -OnlyLastSeen).clientid C.1111111111111111 C.2222222222222222

dev:remarks.maml:para: Search for the client id for the two hosts and return only the client id.

maml:description.maml:para: Search for a specific client id and return the computername.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-GRRComputerNameFromClientId -Credential $creds -ClientId c.1111111111111111 PS C:\> Get-GRRComputerNameFromClientId -Credential $creds -ClientId c.1111111111111111, c.2222222222222222 PS C:\> c.1111111111111111 | Get-GRRComputerNameFromClientId -Credential $cred PS C:\> c.1111111111111111,c.2222222222222222 | Get-GRRComputerNameFromClientId -Credential $cred

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the host name for one or multiple client ids. Use the parameter ClientId or the pipeline as input.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-GRRConfig Loaded the following configuration: ...\powergrr-config.ps1
GRRUrl: ... GRRIgnoreCertificateErrors: ... GRRClientCertIssuer: ...

dev:remarks.maml:para: Read the current config.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of all available flows.
List all flows and allow filtering based on category, name and doc content.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-GRRFlowDescriptor -Credential $cred

dev:remarks.maml:para: List all available flows.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $ret = Get-GRRFlowDescriptor -Credential $cred PS C:\> $ret | select name

dev:remarks.maml:para: List all available flows and display all the flow names.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $ret = Get-GRRFlowDescriptor -Credential $cred PS C:\> $ret | where { $_.category -match "memory"}

dev:remarks.maml:para: List all available flows from the memory category.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $ret = Get-GRRFlowDescriptor -Credential $cred PS C:\> $ret | where { $_.category -match "file"} | select name

dev:remarks.maml:para: List all available flows from the file category and display only the flow names.

command:example.maml:title: Example 5
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-GRRFlowDescriptor -Credential $cred | ? { $_.name -match "proc" }

dev:remarks.maml:para: List all available flows where "proc" is in the flow name.

maml:description.maml:para: Get flow results for a specific client and a flow.

maml:Description.maml:para: Flow id for which the results should be returned.
Flow id for which the results should be returned.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $res = Get-GRRFlowResult -Credential $cred -ComputerName u261354 -FlowId "F:11111111" PS C:\> $res.items.payload | ConvertFrom-Base64

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the flow results and decode the base64 encoded payload.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of available hunts. Filter the list with the parameter or afterwards with PowerShell.

maml:Description.maml:para: Return plain JSON instead of converted JSON.
Text which is contains within the hunt description.
Return plain JSON instead of converted JSON.
Return plain JSON instead of converted JSON.
Text which is contains within the hunt description.
Return plain JSON instead of converted JSON.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-GRRHunts -Credential $cred | select -First 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Find last hunt id. You can use all the filtering from PowerShell. Each hunt is represented as an own PowerShell object. The disadvantage of this POST-filtering is that the command first returns every hunt. See next example to use a PRE-filtering.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-GRRHunts -Credential $cred -Count 5

dev:remarks.maml:para: Find last 5 hunt id. You can use all the filtering from PowerShell. Each hunt is represented as an own PowerShell object. The advantage of this usage is that GRR server filters the hunts on the server before returning the response.

maml:description.maml:para: Get hunt info for a specific hunt.

maml:Description.maml:para: Hunt id for which the info should be returned.
Hunt id for which the info should be returned.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-GRRHuntInfo "H:AAAAAAAA" -Credential $cred

dev:remarks.maml:para: Read the hunt infos based on a hunt id.

maml:description.maml:para: Get hunt results for a specific hunt.

maml:Description.maml:para: Hunt id for which the results should be returned.
Hunt id for which the results should be returned.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $res = Get-GRRHuntResult -HuntId H:AAAAAAAA -Credential $creds PS C:\> ($res.items.payload.stat_entry.aff4path).substring(31) | sort -u PS C:\> $res.items.client_id | sort -u

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get hunt results based on a hunt id. Display all the unique file paths which were found with a file finder hunt. Only display the unique GRR client id's.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-GRRLabel -Credential $creds

dev:remarks.maml:para: Return every label which is available in GRR.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-GRRLabel -Credential $creds | sls osx

dev:remarks.maml:para: Return every available label which contains "osx".

maml:description.maml:para: Return the headers and the websession for a specific GRR server.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Add example description here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Invoke a flow on one or multiple clients.
Invoke a flow on one or multiple clients. The dynamic parameter "Flow" allows using dedicated parameters for each flow type.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-GRRFlow -ComputerName host1 -Credential $cred -Flow FileFinder -path "C:\test.exe" -actiontype hash

dev:remarks.maml:para: Start a new file finder flow.

maml:Description.maml:para: Hunt id for which an approval is created.
The users which have to give the approval.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Display only the approval id after creating the approval.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Hunt id for which an approval is created.
The users which have to give the approval.
Display only the approval id after creating the approval.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-GRRHuntApproval -Credential $cred -HuntId H:AAAAAAAA -NotifiedUsers username -Reason "Hunt for malicious files" -OnlyId

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new hunt approval.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a label on a range of clients.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-GRRLabel -ComputerName host1, host2 -Label label1 -Credential $creds PS C:\> "host1", "host2" | Remove-GRRLabel -Label label1 -Credential $creds

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove the label "label1" to both hosts. It's possible to use pipeline to remove the labels.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-GRRLabel -ComputerName (Find-GRRClient -SearchString keyword -Credential $cred -OnlyNode) -Label test5,test3 -Credential $creds

dev:remarks.maml:para: Use the GRR search to find specific clients on which both labels should be removed.

maml:description.maml:para: Set a label on one or multiple clients.
Set a label on one or multiple clients. The function has pipeline support.

maml:Description.maml:para: Label to set for the clients.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Label to set for the clients.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-GRRLabel -ComputerName host1, host2 -Label label1 -Credential $creds PS C:\> "host1", "host2" | Set-GRRLabel -Label label1 -Credential $creds

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add the label "label1" to both hosts. It's possible to use pipeline to set the labels.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-GRRLabel -ComputerName (Find-GRRClient -SearchString keyword -Credential $cred -OnlyNode) -Label test5,test3 -Credential $creds

dev:remarks.maml:para: Use the GRR search to find specific clients which should be labeled.

maml:description.maml:para: Start a GRR hunt based on the hunt id.

maml:Description.maml:para: HuntId of the hunt which should be started.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Show plain JSON as output instead of the return object.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
HuntId of the hunt which should be started.
Show plain JSON as output instead of the return object.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Start-GRRHunt -Credential $cred -HuntId H:AAAAAAAA

dev:remarks.maml:para: Start the specific hunt. Approval must be granted before.

maml:Description.maml:para: Hunt id which should be stopped.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Hunt id which should be stopped.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Stop-GRRHunt -Credential $cred -HuntId H:7D5E2318

dev:remarks.maml:para: Stop the specific hunt.
